title: The Best Response to a Ticket I've Had
body: I was already playing League for quite a few months and decided it was about time I got some of the champions you can get for free (Alistar via YouTube subscription, Garen by following on Twitter, and Tristana by following on Facebook). I didn't write much in my support ticket other than something along the lines of "hey, nothing happened. What should I do?" The response I got absolutely made my day.

Every time I've had to contact Player Support since the second time I started playing LoL(back a few years now), I've gotten good responses - not always quite that indepth, but in that same vein.

But that might be the best I've seen. Good job Jickoy. :)

I've had a few bumps in the road (like having my support ticket skimmed and solved for the wrong problem over the course of a week, despite me reiterating the problem in every ticket response), but it's really amazing when someone cares so much to respond like this. :D Glad support is treating you well!

In general, most companies' support are very nice... it's just a few bad apples that aren't and since people remember poor support a lot more than good support it leads to the impression that support is awful everywhere.
Oh, yeah. I know what you mean. As someone who works in customer service, I really like to help out nice customers as much as I can. Along with it, I try to be a good customer myself.

I think they have an easier job since it's not though the phone. It must be a lot harder to keep your cool both as a customer and support if you are talking in real time. Just imagine how the first weeks of chat restriction would have looked with phone conversations.
